*div1 type="summary"* *p*Joel R. Poinsett to Austin, Charleston, S. C, October 14, 1832. Comment on Mexican affairs—Pakenham can not blame him for them now. His disgust with the milliners and efforts to thwart them.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Charleston */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="10-14-1832">14 October 1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My dear Sir*/p*
*p*I *date_mentioned n="10-13-1832">yesterday */date_mentioned*received your letters of the *date_mentioned n="08-13-1832">13*/date_mentioned* and *date_mentioned n="08-29-1832">29 August*/date_mentioned* and am very much indebted to you for this mark of your kind remem- brance as well as for the intelligence they contain— I am really sorry to find that *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*should continue to be so convulsed even after the *person_mentioned*arch fiend*/person_mentioned* has left the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*— What will *person_mentioned*Pakenham*/person_mentioned* say now— I did not raise the insurrection this time nor am I in anyway the cause of the revolt in the *location_mentioned*States*/location_mentioned*-— It is inconceivable that he and his *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*should have been so weak as to attribute to me what is owing to the character of the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*and their ignorance of self government— I dare say you will get along very well with *person_mentioned*Fagoaga*/person_mentioned*, but doubt whether you will have long to get on with him— He has not I think, talents for the place he fills— You seem in the dark as [to] his predilections and the cause of *person_mentioned*Pakenham*/person_mentioned*'s coolness and even dissatisfaction with the appointment and I can account for both and give you a little secret history, which may be of use to you In *person_mentioned*Alaman*/person_mentioned*'s first reign as *person_mentioned*Secretary of State*/person_mentioned*, he desired to send this very *person_mentioned*Fagoaga */person_mentioned*to *location_mentioned*London*/location_mentioned*-— *person_mentioned*Victoria*/person_mentioned* objected and*person_mentioned* Mr. Ward*/person_mentioned* objected; but *person_mentioned*Alaman */person_mentioned*who had at heart this nomination addressed himself severally to the *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*and the *person_mentioned*british Charge*/person_mentioned*— To the *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*he said that he ought to overcome his objections because *person_mentioned*Mr. Ward*/person_mentioned* had expressed an earnest desire to have *person_mentioned*Fagoaga */person_mentioned*appointed to his *person_mentioned*Court*/person_mentioned*—and to *person_mentioned*Ward */person_mentioned*that the *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*desired this so much that he thought the objections he had advanced ought to be withdrawn—*/p*
*p*At length an eclaricissiment took place between the *person_mentioned*parties*/person_mentioned*— The *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*apologised and expressed his regret that he could not oblige *person_mentioned*Mr. Ward*/person_mentioned* in this matter, the other was stupefied— They mutually explained, and agreed that the *person_mentioned*secretary */person_mentioned*had sought to serve them both a scurvy trick— *person_mentioned*Ward */person_mentioned*called at my *location_mentioned*house */location_mentioned*on his return from this interview at the *location_mentioned*palace */location_mentioned*He was shocked at the duplicity of *person_mentioned*Alaman*/person_mentioned*— He then told me, that *person_mentioned*Fagoaga*/person_mentioned*'s predelections were altogether french—that he was a Bourbonite and that it was certain the *person_mentioned*french ambassador in *location_mentioned*London*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* would be instantly informed of every thing which passed between *person_mentioned*Mr Canning*/person_mentioned* and the *person_mentioned*Mexican Envoy*/person_mentioned* He was right—all the *person_mentioned*Fagoaga*/person_mentioned*'s are *person_mentioned*french */person_mentioned*in their predilections—*person_mentioned*Jose Maria */person_mentioned*desired the ratification of the plan of *location_mentioned*Iguala */location_mentioned*and treaties of *location_mentioned*Cordova */location_mentioned*and so did this *person_mentioned*Sor- Dn Francisco*/person_mentioned*— I thank him however for his compliments to our *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and sorry I am to say they are not deserved— Ambitious and bad *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*are exciting the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*against the *person_mentioned*federal government*/person_mentioned*— *person_mentioned*Calhoun*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Hamilton*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*McDuffie */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Hayne */person_mentioned*have driven our *person_mentioned*countrymen */person_mentioned*stark mad and our once loyal and glorious little *location_mentioned*state */location_mentioned*is about to disgrace herself and bring ruin upon her *person_mentioned*citizens*/person_mentioned*— We have used every exertion to check them in their mad career, but in vain— They have gained almost all the elections and will in all probability have a *person_mentioned*constitutional majority*/person_mentioned* in favor of conven- tions— In this hope the *person_mentioned*Governor */person_mentioned*has called together the *person_mentioned*Legislature */person_mentioned*for *date_mentioned n="10-22-1832">monday next*/date_mentioned*— The object is to call a convention of the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*and nullify the tariff act— If *person_mentioned*General Jackson*/person_mentioned* is reelected I have no fears of the result— He will I am sure act with vigour and put down these *person_mentioned*nullifiers*/person_mentioned*, forever— It is a hard case to stand by and see our *location_mentioned*city */location_mentioned*ruined by these *person_mentioned*men*/person_mentioned*, who are guided alone by their personal ambition— We had a most animated contest and the union party put itself under my guidance, but it had been so mismanaged, that I could not restore it to order in the short time I had the command—not three weeks, We will do better in another year if the contest is not decided by the Sword before that period—- In *location_mentioned*every other part of the United States*/location_mentioned* there reigns the most perfect tranquillity and unparallelled prosperity—Even here if these *person_mentioned*agitators */person_mentioned*would let us alone, we are more prosperous than I have ever known *location_mentioned*Carolina */location_mentioned*to be— I cannot think of them or write of them with any patience— I will inform you soon of what our assembly of wise *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*do at *location_mentioned*Columbia*/location_mentioned*— I cannot doubt of *person_mentioned*Genl Jackson*/person_mentioned*'s reelection—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J. R. Poinsett*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
